text.section: Any person who willfully burns, defaces or destroys a covered bridge designated as a state shrine by the Kentucky Heritage Commission or by the heritage division shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars ($500) or confined in the county jail for not less than thirty (30) days or more than six (6) months or both. This shall be in addition to other penalties.

Any person who exceeds the posted weight limits for a covered wooden bridge designated as a state shrine shall be fined not less than ten dollars ($10) or more than five hundred dollars ($500). This shall be in addition to other penalties.

law.history: Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 396, sec. 47, effective July 15, 1982. -- Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 170, sec. 3. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 364, sec. 3.
